content:
The following age restrictions applies for Section 9:
(a) You are between the age of eighteen (18) years to sixty-five (65) years old;
(b) Your child(ren) are above six (6) months but below twenty-one (21) years old or up to twenty-three (23) years of age if studying full time in a recognized institution of higher learning.

The maximum liability under this section shall be limited to $35,000 for any one Accident and in the aggregate.
questions: How does the age eligibility criteria for Section 9 apply to both the insured and their children, and what documentation might be required to prove full-time student status for children up to twenty-three years old?
What are the implications of the maximum liability limit of $35,000 per Accident and in aggregate under Section 9 for claims involving multiple injuries or incidents?
If a child is exactly six months old or exactly twenty-one years old, how does the policy interpret eligibility under Section 9, and are there any exceptions for borderline ages?
How does the age restriction for Section 9 interact with claims involving dependents who are not full-time students but are between twenty-one and twenty-three years old?
In the event of multiple accidents involving the insured and their eligible children under Section 9, how is the $35,000 aggregate limit applied across these incidents?
What happens if an insured person is sixty-six years old at the time of an accident—are they excluded from Section 9 coverage, and are there any provisions for coverage beyond the stated age limit?
How does the policy define a recognized institution of higher learning for the purpose of extending coverage to children up to twenty-three years old under Section 9?
Are there any general or section-specific exclusions that override the age eligibility criteria in Section 9, particularly for claims involving older children or adults?
How does the policy handle claims under Section 9 if the insured’s child is studying part-time rather than full-time, given the age limits specified?
What documentation is required to verify the age and student status of children claiming benefits under Section 9, and how does this affect claim processing times?
If an accident involves both the insured and their eligible children, how is the $35,000 maximum liability divided or prioritized among claimants under Section 9?
Does the age restriction in Section 9 apply at the time of policy purchase, the time of the accident, or the time of claim submission, and what are the implications for coverage?
How does the policy address coverage under Section 9 for children who have recently graduated but are still within the age limit—are they considered eligible if not currently studying?
In cases where a child is studying overseas in a recognized institution, does Section 9 coverage still apply, and are there any additional conditions or exclusions?
How does the maximum liability limit of $35,000 under Section 9 compare to other sections of the policy, and what impact does this have on overall claim strategy?
Are there any provisions for automatic extensions or exceptions to the age restrictions in Section 9 for children with disabilities or special educational needs?
How does the policy treat claims under Section 9 if the insured or their child falsifies age or student status information, considering general exclusions and potential fraud clauses?
What is the process for determining whether a child qualifies as a full-time student in a recognized institution for Section 9 coverage, and how does this affect eligibility?
If an insured person has multiple children with different ages and student statuses, how does Section 9 apply coverage and limits across these dependents?
How do the age restrictions and maximum liability limits in Section 9 interact with other policy provisions related to pre-existing conditions or optional covers?
